data.title: Georgina Winthrop, Robert Stevenson
data.meta_description: The couple knew each other as children but first connected as adults when their families vacationed together in the Bahamas in 2012.
data.text:
Georgina Cheston Winthrop, a daughter of Sydney Cheston Winthrop and Jonathan Winthrop of Boston, was married Sept. 17 to Robert Hooper Stevenson, the son of Louisa Jenkins Stevenson and Robert H. Stevenson of Glyndon, Md. The Rev. Jane Cornman performed the ceremony at St. Maryâ€™s-by-the-Sea Episcopal Church in Northeast Harbor, Me.

Ms. Winthrop, 25, will continue to use her name professionally. She is the fine art specialist at Grogan & Company, an auction house for art and jewelry in Boston. She graduated from Harvard.

Her father retired as a partner in Associated Architects, a Boston firm.

The bride is a descendant of John Winthrop, a founder and governor of the Massachusetts Bay Colony. She is also the great-great granddaughter of John F. Dodge, a founder of the Dodge automobile company.

Mr. Stevenson, 32, is a senior business analyst at Eagle Investment Systems, a financial software developer in Wellesley, Mass. He graduated from Hobart College.

His mother retired as a board member of the Carroll County Land Trust, a rural environmental trust in Westminster, Md. His father retired as a manager in the technology group and as an underwriter in Baltimore for Equitable, an insurance unit of the AXA Group.

The groom is a descendant of Charles Carroll and William Hooper, both signers of the Declaration of Independence.

The fathers of the bride and groom grew up together in Hamilton, Mass., went to college together, and often visited as they were beginning their careers. So the bride and groom knew each other as small children. But they first connected as adults in 2012, when their families spent a week together in the Bahamas.
